data.title: Fresh food, fast service but no vegetarian options
data.text: This is my daughter's favorite new restaurant.  The food is fresh and the service is very fast, with very good prices.  However she brought me there and there was nothing on the menu I could eat except for white rice.  No vegetarian options at all.  So I won't be going back.

data.title: You have to go...
data.text:
Great Vietnamese Pho, fast and delicious. There's no mistake with this one, the waiting for the food, once your in the table, is really fast, no more than 5 minutes, even less. There's alway line in busy hours (6-7), so you might have to wait to be sit, but as I said, once at the table your order will be there while your closing your eyes. 

Give it a try. If you like this kind of food I'm sure you will like it. Prices are really friendly and portions very generous. Oh, try their coffee... umm. Yummy.

data.title: Great Food, Great Value
data.text:
Superb value. Great taste. If you like Pho, you owe it to yourself to grab a bowl. Whether small, medium, or large it is the perfect comfort food.  Who can argue with chicken or beef noodle soup?  Rice and vermicelli dishes are also quite good   

Parking is the only tricky task. Given the popularity, you may find yourself circling and walking to the restaurant since the small (tiny) lot is perpetually packed.   Better to look at street parking near the VW shop or just past the restaurant

Bottom Line: awesome quantity of food. Superb value

data.title: Awesome Pho!
data.text: When I'm sick and don't feel good, this is the place that we go to have soup! Love it!! We also enjoy it just to have lunch. :)

data.title: Good service
data.text: Good pho place by walnut creek Bart. Typical pho that is a tad expensive but location, location, location. Good service.

data.title: Good, not excellent
data.text: This is a favorite of our son who generally has excellent taste in Vietnamese food, having been married to a Vietnamese woman.  I find it good, but not excellent. I tend to order noodle dishes rather than pho which perhaps I should switch to.  At $9-10 a dish, it's not bad, particularly when we have the whole family.

data.title: Average taste, good service
data.text: The food here is not so authentic.  The taste is average.  It is good for something quick or if you are desperate for pho.  It's nice they offer small, medium, large sizes for the soups.  Fruit drinks use syrup not real or even frozen fruit.  The service is really good, staff is attentive and friendly.

data.title: Dependable
data.text: I've been here a few times to get my pho on. It's in a pretty busy part of main, but they have a decent amount of parking in the back. There's always a ton of attentive and thorough staff, and the pho is always yummy.

data.title: Go-to Pho in Walnut Creek
data.text: Whenever is cold or rainy or we feel like Pho, we go to here. Parking sucks especially since they only have 10 or so spaces so you'd have to park on the metered spaces in the street. Seafood Pho is good and so is the normal beef Pho. I haven't tried the other foods yet though

data.title: quick bite, quick service, yummy pho, pork chop and avocado smoothie
data.text: when we're craving for pho, and we're around wc, this is our go to place. the service is quick and food is pretty good. we usually order a bowl of pho, porkchop with rice, and avocado smoothie. there can be a line during weekends, but that is a good thing, because it's pretty big and diners come and go.

data.title: Yum!!
data.text: Love this place! Great atmosphere  Very authentic Vietnamese food.  Good Imperial rolls, love their pho noodles

data.title: Good but not great
data.text: If you're craving Vietnamese food and don't want to drive down to San Jose, then Kevin's Noodle House is a safe bet.  It's always crowded here so prepared to wait for a table.  A little pricey for this type of food, but that is to be expected since it's in Walnut Creek.

data.title: Friends brought me here
data.text: busy place hard to find parking... but the food was excellent and that's what's important right? Sure

data.title: Great Value
data.text: Great value for eating out with the family. Kevin's tends to be crowded and parking is an issue.  Otherwise a good place to go for authentic Vietnamese noodles.

data.title: Yummy Pho
data.text:
We had driven by Kevin's many times and it took us moving back to Ohio and back to California to finally come visit. We did a carry out order, we wandered in and went right to the register to place our order, the food was ready in less than 10 minutes, super fast and fresh. 
We ordered the spring rolls (with Shrimp only) they were super fresh and the peanut sauce is very fresh and tasty.  We also both ordered a large Pho, both with Beef Broth and mine with just chicken and hubby's was chicken and shrimp. They give you a generous amount of noodles and meat as well as bean sprouts, cilantro and all of the other essential sauces needed for a great Pho. We got home and prepared our Pho's to eat, very easy to put together and so tasty. Definitely a place that we will be returning to many times, prices are good, carry out is super quick and definitely enough for 2 or 3 servings (with a large).

data.title: Tasty Creative Broth-Based Bowls - Generous portions, reasonable price
data.text: The atmosphere is no big deal, but the menu is varied and bowls are tasty and generously portioned.  Great for lunch.

data.title: Street food
data.text: It is street food, test like street food and looks like street food. Cheap with cheap ingredients. Always packed. Just go in you are craving for Vietnamese food.

data.title: Excellent for Pho
data.text: Our go to place for Pho - you won't be disappointed.  There is always a line but it moves fast, but be prepared to wait - it's definitely worth it.

data.title: Visited many times and will return again
data.text: Great place at the right price with parking. Tasty so take the whole family or freinds. I like every thing

data.title: Good food
data.text: I would have liked to give this an excellent review however, the service is poor.  The food is great though.  After going in here several times I noticed that it is not first come first serve.  It seems if they know the customer they get immediate service.  I didn't think it was as clean as it could be and the waiters sit around and watch you eat.  Not sure if I will return.  I might give it one more chance.
